newsitem.title: NIGERIA: Opposition figure detained in Nigeria.
newsitem.headline: Opposition figure detained in Nigeria.

text.p: A politician opposed to Nigeria's military government, Olabiyi Durojaiye, has been detained by security forces, his associate said on Wednesday.
Veteran opposition lawyer Abraham Adesanya told journalists Durojaiye was arrested by seven men at around 4.a.m (0300 GMT) on Tuesday after they searched home at Ikeja, near Lagos.
Adesanya said he did not know where Durojaiye had been taken.
There has been no official confirmation of the arrest.
Durojaiye is a former presidential aspirant who lost in his bid for the nomination of one of the political parties in annulled elections in 1993.
The presumed winner of the election, Moshood Abiola, has been among dozens of political detainees since he declared himself president in 1994 in defiance of the military.
Africa's most populous nation is been under fire from Western countries for human rights abuses and lack of democracy.
Three prominent prisoners were released last month to coincide with a visit by a delegation of the Commonwealth of Britain and its former colonies.
